channel.title: Make hats, get cash
channel.description: [url]https://kotaku.com/5669981/making-team-fortress-2-hats-turns-out-to-be-very-profitable[/url] [quote] Five TF2 community members—Rob Laro, Shawn Spetch, Steven Skidmore, Spencer Kern, and Shaylyn Hamm—created new items for the game ranging from crocodile hats to jars of milk to sleek black rocket launchers, which players can purchase in-game. Two weeks later, some of these guys are sitting on royalties of up to $47,000 USD. [/quote] Daaaaaaaamn.

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
I’ve spent about $100 in the TF2 store.

$60 of it was on server gifts, the Spy Polycount Pack, some keys for crates and a random weapon or two.

I won’t ever buy hats, I like the idea of randomly getting them from a drop.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
I have a job, I have money.

I am not some worthless faggot who sits of forums complaining about what other people buy and insult those who do buy items ingame.

I also bought some hats.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
The lady that made the Saharan Spy stuff had more than enough to pay off her student loans.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: gugamilare
item.description:
I think everyone should spend the money in whatever they want to, I don’t care. Specially if I’m the one selling :3

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
When I first saw a hat listed for $17 I had to do a quadruple take. There are a lot of suckers playing TF2, apparently. Good on the dudes who made all that money, but shame on the idiots who gave it to them.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
gugamilare:

I actually liked that painting. I wouldn’t pay 140 million on it, obviously, but a lot better than a hat in a game.

I personally do not like the painting about 28 million times as much as the hats, so yeah, its just a touch over priced.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Never underestimate the power of true fanboyism.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Someonerandm:

The concerning thing here is that over 50,000 dollars have been spent by people in order to get unimportant in game items. People really are idiots.

The item creators only get payed 25% of the price so… it’s around something like $900,000 that has been spent on those items alone in the first two weeks.
Valve are richer than they were it seems.

Read full topic

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
It’s actually a lot worse because that’s some shit people use irl, while the hats are completely useless other than showing off to some anonymous guys and girls. Those things you mentioned are more usefull for that purpose because you can show it off to people who aren’t anonymous.

OT: Daaaaaaaaaaaaaaamn

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Someonerandm:

The concerning thing here is that over 50,000 dollars have been spent by people in order to get unimportant in game items. People really are idiots.

Considering that we live in a world with 24 million dollar cars,8 million dollar iPhones, and 140 million dollar paintings of nothing, this doesn’t really seem all that surprising.

item.title: Make hats, get cash
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
https://kotaku.com/5669981/making-team-fortress-2-hats-turns-out-to-be-very-profitable

Five TF2 community members—Rob Laro, Shawn Spetch, Steven Skidmore, Spencer Kern, and Shaylyn Hamm—created new items for the game ranging from crocodile hats to jars of milk to sleek black rocket launchers, which players can purchase in-game. Two weeks later, some of these guys are sitting on royalties of up to $47,000 USD.

Daaaaaaaamn.

Read full topic
